input: Charlie is red. Dave is blue. Dave is furry. Dave is smart. Fiona is furry. Fiona is smart. Gary is red. If something is blue then it is furry. All blue things are red. Quiet things are smart. If something is cold and blue then it is quiet. Young, cold things are blue. All red things are furry. All blue, red things are cold. If something is furry then it is blue. If Fiona is young then Fiona is blue. Question: Gary is smart.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Charlie : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Fiona : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop
constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Red Charlie
axiom T2 : Blue Dave
axiom T3 : Furry Dave
axiom T4 : Smart Dave
axiom T5 : Furry Fiona
axiom T6 : Smart Fiona
axiom T7 : Red Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Furry x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Red x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Quiet x → Smart x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x ∧ Blue x → Quiet x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Young x ∧ Cold x → Blue x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Furry x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x ∧ Red x → Cold x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Blue x
axiom R9 : Young Fiona → Blue Fiona

theorem gary_is_smart : Smart Gary :=
begin
  apply R3,
  apply R4,
  split,
  apply R7,
  split,
  apply R8,
  apply R6,
  exact T7,
  apply R2,
  apply R8,
  apply R6,
  exact T7,
end

-- The answer is True
